job_title: Associate Professor, College Or University in Saint Joseph, MO
pros: Great size, you get to know your staff and faculty. Good location and pretty campus. Most people are very nice and a family of sorts, BUT. . .
cons: So many: insurance is very high for family coverage, resources are becoming more and more limited, lots of organizational restructuring currenlty, and many faculty and staff have been fired due to the restructuring with the past year. Many more faculty will be leaving this summer due to the entrenchment policies. So much potential here, BUT. . .

job_title: Student Technical Director in Saint Joseph, MO
pros: It gives you a lot of hands on experience if you are in video production to any extent. You work with a camera, audio, how to set up by yourself, and cross training is available for classroom services; where you can help with Zoom Classes, the cinema cage, working in the studio, digitizing, and so much more.
cons: It's kind of in a bubble on it's own as a position on Campus. It doesn't work with the journalism department too much, except setting up equipment, you can do personal projects if you are in Cinema or Voice Acting, but the IMC is still seperate from Cinema except for also providing equipment. We mostly film lectures and events on campus that marketing doesn't pick up, although they still expect us to send them the footage so they can use it later. I just wish we were a bit more involved with everyone since we have all the equipment, otherwise, I thoroughly appreciate it.

review_title: Good place to kick off my career.
job_title: Intern in Saint Joseph, MO
